pages.title: Backpacks
pages.text: $(key)Backpacks$() provide extra storage. Equip one in your $(key)trinket slot$() and press $(bold)B$() to open it.$(br2)Upgrade backpacks with materials like $(key)iron ingots$(), $(key)gold ingots$(), and $(key)diamonds$() (craft in a $(bold)crafting table$(); $(welcome/emi#ru)check recipes$() for details). Higher tiers provide more space and extra upgrade slots.

pages.title: Tip
pages.text: $(br)If you find leather hard to obtain, you can try this recipe.

pages.title: Tom's Simple Storage
pages.text: $(br)Place a $(key)Inventory Connector$() next to your chests (or other containers such as barrels), along with a $(key)Storage Terminal$() or $(key)Crafting Terminal$(). After that, you can manage all items across your containers through the $(key)terminal$().
A chest must be connected to a $(key)Inventory Connector$() to be accessible from the $(key)terminal$().

pages.title: Wireless Storage
pages.text: Build a level $(bold)4$()+ $(key)Beacon$(), or place your storage system near a high-enough $(mechanic/ocean#pivot)Consciousness Pivot$() ($(key)Consciousness Pedestal$() stack above $(bold)4$()). Bind an $(key)Advanced Wireless Terminal$() to your terminal, and keep chunks loaded with a $(key)Chunk Loader$() to access storage remotely across dimensions.

$(br)Note: items with NBT are items that contain extra data, including $(bold)enchanted items$(), $(bold)durability items$(), etc. They usually do not stack.$(br2)Connecting large amounts of such items to a storage system can cause $(bold)severe lag$() and impact server performance. It is recommended to store them in $(bold)separate chests$(), or process them with $(util/illusion)Illusion$().
